content: Singaporean politician (born 1985) **Jackson Lam Weiliang**[a] (born 8 January 1985) is a Singaporean politician. A member of the governing [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) (PAP), he has been the [Member of Parliament](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) (MP) for the Nee Soon East division of [Nee Soon Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Nee_Soon_Group_Representation_Constituency) (GRC) since 2025. ## Education and career Lam graduated with an Honours degree in Business Management from the [University of Bedfordshire](/wiki/University_of_Bedfordshire) in 2013. He is also the treasurer of the Singapore Wushu Dragon & Lion Dance Federation. ## Political career In 2013, Lam became a PAP activist for the Chong Pang division of Nee Soon GRC. He became the branch secretary in 2019. In October 2023, Lam replaced [Lee Hong Chuang](/wiki/Lee_Hong_Chuang) as the PAP branch chairperson for [Hougang Single Member Constituency](/wiki/Hougang_Single_Member_Constituency) (SMC), held by the [Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore)) (WP). He would serve until February 2025, when he was replaced by Marshall Lim. In March 2025, Lam was spotted with [K. Shanmugam](/wiki/K._Shanmugam) in [Nee Soon GRC](/wiki/Nee_Soon_Group_Representation_Constituency); he would later be nominated as a PAP candidate for the constituency. He was elected into Parliament after the PAP team he belonged to defeated [Ravi Philemon](/wiki/Ravi_Philemon) and his team representing [Red Dot United](/wiki/Red_Dot_United) (RDU) with 73.81% of the vote. ## Notes [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)Preceded by[K. Shanmugam](/wiki/K._Shanmugam) [Derrick Goh](/wiki/Derrick_Goh) [Carrie Tan](/wiki/Carrie_Tan) [Louis Ng](/wiki/Louis_Ng) [Muhammad Faishal Ibrahim](/wiki/Muhammad_Faishal_Ibrahim) **Member of Parliament for [Nee Soon GRC](/wiki/Nee_Soon_Group_Representation_Constituency)** 2025–present Served alongside: **(2025–present): [K. Shanmugam](/wiki/K._Shanmugam), [Syed Harun Alhabsyi](/wiki/Syed_Harun_Alhabsyi), [Lee Hui Ying](/wiki/Lee_Hui_Ying), [Goh Hanyan](/wiki/Goh_Hanyan)****Incumbent** This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Jackson Lam
